Class General

  • java.lang.Object
    • General
  • public class General
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains the main method which starts the program in which the menu is present. This class also contains 2 minor validation methods for integer input.
    Author:
    truth

        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • displayMenu

        public void displayMenu()

      • processUserChoices

        public void processUserChoices​(BinaryTree[] trees)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        A large method to deal with the choice the user inputs. A while loop is used both to repeat the menu until the user selects exit, and to repeat the menu if an invalid input in given. In majority of cases the program will request the user to select with which languages they are dealing with. This is because we have 4 binary tree data structures. When the user has selected the desired languages he is allowed to progress with the function he has selected as he is finally allowed to process the correct tree. Each case in the menu is easily understood for its base functions outside of the input method and check linked to it. This method is not prioritised by the program as it contains no special functions or methods.
        Parameters:
        trees - - An array containing 4 binary trees.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - an exception call added as the program uses it to reinforce the program of breaking. It is only added as a try and catch wasn't implimented in a specific method.
